entry.title: What Is the U.S.'s Long-Term Policy Toward Russia Now?
entry.content: U.S. officials say it is far too soon to draw up a new long-term posture toward Russia, but some wonder what diplomatic and commercial relations would look like if a cease-fire were to be achieved in Ukraine.

entry.title: France's Le Pen Plays Down Far-Right Agenda to Broaden Appeal
entry.content: The leader of the National Rally party’s new approach, coupled with a significant rightward shift in French politics over the past five years, helped her win 22.9% of the estimated vote in the first round of France’s presidential election on Sunday. President Emmanuel Macron received 28.2%.

entry.title: Ukraine, Russia Gear Up for War's Biggest Battles
entry.content: The countries poured reinforcements into eastern Ukraine, as refugees fled the looming Russian assault. Unlike the first part of the war, with its guerrilla tactics, officials expect large-scale tank and artillery battles for the eastern Donbas region.

entry.title: Israel's 'War Between the Wars' With Iran Expands Across the Middle East
entry.content: The Israeli military says it has carried out more than 400 airstrikes targeting Iran and its allies.
